intro: Jovetia, commonly known as the sea hibiscus, is a genus of flowering plants in the Malvaceae family. These plants are typically found in coastal areas and are adapted to saline environments. Jovetia species are characterized by their showy, hibiscus-like flowers that range in color from yellow to red. They have succulent leaves and stems, which help them retain moisture in arid conditions. The plant is often used in landscaping due to its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal regions.
